text.content: A number of tables, properties, user roles, script includes, client scripts, UI policies, and business rules are installed with the legacy Software Asset Management
Note: Demo data is available with the legacy Software Asset Management

rich_text.plain_text: Note: Demo data is available with the legacy Software Asset Management

text.content: Legacy Software Asset Management plugin tables

Describes a computer in terms of the attributes IBM uses for its PVU licensing model. If they are all identical in terms of the attributes used for PVU licensing, a row can be associated with one or more discovered computers.
Encodes the information specified by the IBM
Table of Processor Value Units per core
and is used in matching a computer's processor definition to a PVU cost for that computer. Each row in this table is a mapping between a set of processors and the associated PVU cost (per core).
Configures license counting options for software models.

Stores records of software counter compliance issues that are due to
 violations other than installs exceeding rights, such as:
‚Ä¢ Maximum CPU/user count exceeded, based on model limits.
‚Ä¢ Maximum or minimum rights rules not followed, based on model limits.
‚Ä¢ Options installed on a server with a license that does not support options
 (Oracle).
Reconciles a software installation or usage with its corresponding software license and entitlement. The software counting logic automatically generates and maintains these records.
Stores read-only copies of software counter records, which the system generates automatically each time a software counter finishes counting licenses.
Records all software counter results. Organizes the results based on the Grouping field (such as Company, Department, or Location) on the Software Counter record.
Aggregates all the software counter details for a given allocation state, a given group, and a given software counter. The software counting logic automatically generates and maintains these records.
Stores a unique and definitive list of all software found by a discovery tool.
Associates software discovery models and the hardware on which they are installed.
Associates software discovery models and the hardware that uses the models. ServiceNow Discovery does not populate the Software Usage
table. Use a third-party tool to add information about software assets to the Software Usage table.
plugin adds the following system properties.
Legacy Software Asset Management plugin properties

Defines the number of days after which a software install is deleted if not
 discovered with the configuration item. Use a value that is greater than the
 number of days between consecutive discovery runs.
‚Ä¢ Type: integer
‚Ä¢ Default value: 7
‚Ä¢ Location: System Properties [sys_properties] table
plugin adds the following user roles.
Legacy Software Asset Management plugin user roles
Can create, edit, change, and manage software licenses. Can edit the Software model field on a Discovery model. Can approve a model. Has full control of the
. Controls the legacy IBM PVU Process Pack, if activated.
plugin adds the following script includes.
Legacy Software Asset Management plugin script includes
Matches a discovery model with a software product model.
Contains utilities for managing the Processor Definition
Contains logic that determines the IBM PVU pricing associated with a given processor. Also generates an event when a processor mapping is not found.
Deprecated. Used by the fix job that migrates software license management data to the legacy Software Asset Management
Contains functions for handling suite inference on software installations.
Generates models and counters for the legacy Software Asset Management
plugin adds the following client scripts.
